Reviews.Title: “A bit high priced”
Reviews.Author: erikbekker
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok and the rooms where large for London standards. But a bit too high priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great staff”
Reviews.Author: WakefieldMark
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Lane Mews on business . The location is excellent and I was made to feel very welcome by the staff . My room was ready when I arrived and it had been recently updated . My room was quiet , at just the right temperature with a really comfortable bed . Location wise, it is perfect for central London and Shepherds Market area is right on the doorstep . Breakfast was good and overall it was an easy stay . Would I stay again , absolutely .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LeedsLizzie040
Reviews.Content: I was worried after reading previous reviews but was really pleasantly surprised, I had booked this hotel for some of my companys directors and board members and the rooms were lovely, the staff helpful, would definitely book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Handy alternative to the nearby Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Rainsford
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the back of the London Hilton in Park Lane and is a lower cost alternative for anyone who does not need the full range of services that the large 5 star chains can provide. The hotel's main attraction is its location and its lower room charge rates. Don't expect to stay in the best appointed of rooms but this hotel's rooms are comfortable enough and are fine for relatively short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I dreaded from reading the previous reviews....”
Reviews.Author: Vestfoldgirl
Reviews.Content: After having read the reviews on trip advisor I was not really optimistic about this hotel, but my employer had booked it for me, so it was not really something I had choosed myself. The location is good as it is about 10-15 minutes walk to Piccadelly Circus, and also just a few steps from Hyde Park. It is next to Shepards market where you find restaurants and some typical English pubs. The hotel is in a backstreet, and looks nice from the outside and also the reception area was also OK. Check in was quick, and I was given a "deluxe" room. I took the tiny elevator to the 5 floor. The room was big enough for the 2 nights, the bathroom really small. The room was basically clean, but there were stains on the carpet that probably is impossible to get rid of without replacing it. Also the grouting of the bathroom tiles was really worn and needs an update. The remote control to the TV could have benefited from a good scrubbing... Yuck! The temperature in the room was perfect, so no need to turn on the portable oil heater that was available.Bed was good, slept well as the room also turned towards the backyard I heard no noise from outside. Not very good soundproofing inside the hotel, so could hear the guests in the next door room, but thankfully they also went to bed at a decent hour. TV had very few channels, less than 10 I guess. The free WI-FI worked perfectly in my room. There were no safe, minibar, hair drier or any other extras. There were however coffee and tea to make in the room. The bathroom was barely OK. Large towels are always nice, the bathtub was not tempting to lay in, but water temperature and pressure in the shower was OK. There were also bathrobes available. I did not eat breakfast at this hotel. The woman that checked me out did not show any interest in asking me how the stay had been or saying goodbye... GBP 255 for the 2 nights, just not good value for money. It is hard to rate this hotel, I give it 3, but really it is between 2 and 3. I will not stay here again, unless someone else book and pay the bill....

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Cobalt2009
Reviews.Content: People keep telling me that in general London hotels are bad, even at 300 pounds a night, so what can you demand when you pay less than a 100? The room is shabby and damn cold. They give you a small electric heater which is not sufficient. The wool blanket carries 10 kilos of dust and is unusable. Over all - not a great experience. Will return only at a gunpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could do better”
Reviews.Author: PaulandPenny1967
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is brilliant but we did have some issues. When we booked an executive double and asked for a quiet room we were shocked to be given the room right next to the lift. We were then moved to a room which the receptionist said go look first as it's one that has not been refurbished. Quite frankly it was not worth the money we paid. Third time lucky they upgraded us to a suite which was pretty good. So thank you for that. The hotel is tired and could do with a serious cash injection to bring it up to date. There were oil radiators plugged in all over the hotel which is not ideal. My biggest concern was I ordered full breakfast in our room as it was my partners birthday and it was horrible. I would have preferred to pay more to eat out , I think a fast food chain would have been better. Would I stay here again? Yes but not for the cost and definitely eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Skitot
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at this cute hotel at the back of the Park Lane Hilton. As some reviewers have already identified, the hotel decor is a little tired and shabby but considering the location it offers superb value for money. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming and our room, although small, was clean, warm and contained a very comfortable and enormous Kingsize bed. The bathroom again was clean and contained a decent shower as well as all the usual appointments. I note that at least one reviewer has complained of noisy rooms. We found a room, which faced the main road, surprisingly quiet; and anyway, to expect no noise in the heart of the West End seems a little unrealistic! We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Considering the location the hotel was good value for money but the room was old and could need an update - especially the bed where I could feel all the springs. As always in London the rooms was small. There was no working heating system and it was below 0 outside but there was an electric heater in the room which was sufficient to keep the room warm but a little difficult to control the temperature. Overall I would stay at this hotel again if the price was the same.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place”
Reviews.Author: patelsk142
Reviews.Content: Was confused with someone who recommended Park Lane hotel in London and ended up at the Mews when I should have booked at Park Lane Hilton. Looked impressive from photos but when we got there we were horrified. Cold rooms, mildew, dirty sheets, staff horrible, overall a night mare. Checked out the next morning after a cold and adventurous night. Dont walk-just run away from this place igf you are anyw3here near it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: stevebaker
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!! I booked into this hotel for a romantic trip & it has ruined the relationship. The room was cold (I was given a oil heater which did not work). There was mould in the bathroom. The sheets were stained with gos knows what. I endured a passionlesss night & left. Thank you for ruining my chance of getting my leg over.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favour and cancel any future reservations here”
Reviews.Author: ItalyMel80
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to its location and it appeared to be a lovely hotel to stay, but please do yourself a favour and cancel your reservation if you have already booked here. The exterior is lovely, but as you get closer to your room it goes down hill very fast. We started off in room 315 which was supposed to be a 'deluxe room' but it was so tried and dated, with very badly stained carpets, curtains and a piece of mdf nailed to the front of a unit. I complained to receipt and was moved to room 204 which was a little better but still as a deluxe room did not match their website description. I have written a complaint letter to the manage but i don't hold my breathe getting a reply as i bet they have this all the time. On the plus side this is a great location, and we found a brilliant Tapas bar and restaurant round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled by smart exterier ...”
Reviews.Author: kezziedog
Reviews.Content: Booked a theatre break 31st dec and 1st jan. Exterier and reception looked very smart.But wait till you see the bedroom ! Burned lampshades ... holed blanket...grubby curtains ...and the bathroom was difficult to believe. Bath panel falling off and broken along the floor area , the shower head rusty and loose plug not of right type for plug hole. The oval fitted basin was dirty under the rim. We were unable to use shower or bath whilst we were there. The bathroom door was a joke and had to be slammed to shut it. There was also a large torn area of wallpaper. Next morning we asked to see Manager , and were told unavailable. The only" saving grace" was the pristine bed linen, and restaurant linen. If you visit the "ladies" in the basement , well dont know what to say .... At breakfast we were told breakfast wasnt included until we told them our break included the meal, then they agreed. As we left we filled in a complaint form and asked for a copy . Took Hotel a week to reply offering us a free (night only) this January !!! impossible, we suggested we would be pleased to accept their offer but not until November. Since that we have not heard back, no doubt they are hoping we will give up ! (Staff were fine as was the breakfast ) though there are many places you can get breakfast nearby. Perhaps the manager will answer these comments. ?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - That's About It.”
Reviews.Author: LarisaP
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was the only one I could (barely) afford in a central location in London. It's close to the Green Park Underground station, which is particularly useful, and close to great shopping and visiting opportunities. But at 184 pounds per night (313 CAD per night), I really expected more. While the outside and the lobby of the hotel are well maintained, I was very disappointed with the rest. My room was smaller than my pocket, the ceiling paint was peeling, and the room had an electric space heater to make up for the leaky windows. As others have remarked, I also had a nice view (and was within earshot) of the dumpsters from the Hilton out back. Also, the fire alarm went off twice while I was in my room, because someone's shower made too much steam, and the smoke detector was to close to the bathroom (that's how small the rooms were). Plus, the clerk at reception greeted us with some serious attitude. Not fun at all when you're jetlagged. On the plus side, there were electrical outlets for us North Americans in the room. I will not stay here again. Thank goodness I was only there for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid, go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: martin j
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. My company booked me here thinking it was central and a good hotel. Correct on 1 count. Let me explain. Rude staff arrival, live with that. Pokey double room, bad. Tired furnishings, bad. Disgusting bathrooms, bad. A/c not working, bad.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: cincy814
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, this is definitely not a 4-star hotel anymore. The carpet needs replacing, the mattresses are old, and the furniture and woodwork desperately need some TLC. If you are looking for a suite that you will spend a lot of time in during the day, this place is not for you. However, it was EXACTLY what I needed - an inexpensive place to sleep in a great location. I was able to stay here for less than half the cost of the expensive hotel where my friends stayed, which was a mere 8 minute walk away. It's close to the Green Park tube stop on the Picadilly line, which makes for a nice transfer to and from Heathrow. It's close to Buckingham Palace, a short walk to Trafalgar Square, and within walking distance to Big Ben. Pretty much a perfect location. That's what you're paying for, and it's a LOT less than the other hotels in the area. It's a trade off, but for me, it was worth it. I left my room at 8 am, and didn't come home until past 10 pm. After a day of sightseeing and trekking around the city, I was able to fall asleep on that old mattress in no time. The bathroom was very clean, and although the water wasn't piping hot, it was sufficient for a morning shower and the toiletries were nice. The hotel staff was pleasant, and I didn't hear anything from the other rooms or outside as some others have mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: JonesRon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well positioned for shopping in Oxford Street and access to central London and particularly Shepherd Market. Lots of good pubs and restaurants nearby. My room was clean though a little jaded. However I enjoyed my stay and the breakfast. I did get a reduced room rate through laterooms. I certainly didn't experience any of the problems mentioned in other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel condition etc.”
Reviews.Author: tinachow
Reviews.Content: this hotel is more runned down and over quoted as per a four star hotel & the photo showned on their web site. Although many aspects are acceptable, the bathroom of the rooms are the part that should really be re generated. The staff is quite friendly, but know little to what is happening around London to offer help to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “should have looked at Trip Advisor before I booked”
Reviews.Author: TripTripper66
Reviews.Content: stupidly booked it from its cheating on-line boutique looking web site wrong! It's worn out, and smells! Rooms are very small with ridiculously awkward bathrooms Run the hot tap and wait for several years Breakfast was dire, joke shop rubber eggs, scrambled eggs with a crust Dont do it

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaF9
Reviews.Content: I would not recomend stayng in this hotel. The first room I was given was absolutely filthy, there were around 10 insects crawling in the bath and lots of hairs in the bath from the previous occupants! The carpet was stained and dirty, the grout around the tiles in the bathroom were absolutely full of mould and grime, and thats where the grout hadn't rotted away. I telephoned reception who were hepful and arranged for a new room for me. Well that's why I have given one star, thist room was marginally cleaner. After having a shower I felt I need another one to wash my feet after walking on the carpet. Rooms are in dire need of a refurb and a good clean!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: beauty-on-the-fire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, as stated in the other reviews it is a 5 minute walk to the nearest tube station, & is very close to Hyde Park. This made it perfect for us, as our intention was to go to Winter Wonderland in Hyde Park. (FYI Winter Wonderland is great! if you're nearby, go & check it out, you can't fail to feel festive!) The heater had been left on for us so our room was lovely & toasty warm- just what we wanted after being out in the cold all day. The room was lovely & clean, but just an average room really, with a view out on the back lane behind the hotel. We may have preferred a slightly larger duvet as the one in the so room was a bit narrow, but this is really just personal preference. Good selection of continental & full english for the breakfast which was included in our rate. Tea & coffee making facilities in the room, but no mini bar. Not a bad hotel, but also nothing special. There were some renovations/ carpet laying & painting in the lobby during our stay. This was not noisy nor did it disturb us, however it may be a good idea to extend those renovations to the upstairs corridors which looked a little bit worn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ceri25
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is the perfect location. We were in London to attend an investure ceremony at Buckingham palace so it was only a 10 minute walk across Green park. And if you go in December its a two minute walk away from the Winter Wonderland in Hyde Park which is great fun. Nearest tube is Green Park which is 5 minute walk and only couple of stops to Covent Garden, Oxford Street and Kings Cross. The rooms are rather tired and the lift is tiny. Breakfast was very average and the staff didn't really know what was going on and you had to ask them to clear your plates away. But very good value considering your in Mayfair.

Reviews.Title: “Typical London hotel”
Reviews.Author: katrin_samlik
Reviews.Content: Nothing special but nothing disturbing either. Small and worn-out rooms, tiny lift. But everything you need is there â€“ free wireless in the lobby, bathrobe in room and a nice breakfast. Walking distance to Green Park station â€“ about 7 min. Around the corner are two small grocery stores and several pubs. Oxford Street and Piccadilly Circus is about a 15 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: dric0327
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nicely located in mayfair - very close to walk to attractions. The hotel is needing some TLC and refurb especially to the bedroom and corridors. The room we stayed in (standard double) was small and basic and for the price is not good value - however is anything good value in Mayfair ?. The service was excellent at the reception and at breakfast with really helpful and chatty staff. Overall the hotel dispointed us - we felt we deserved more for Â£210 night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mayfair location. Friendly service. That's it.”
Reviews.Author: Weegieexpat
Reviews.Content: I needed to find a Mayfair hotel at very late notice and booked this online for Â£168. The location couldn't be more central and the mews is quaint, touristy and close to some great resturants. The service at front desk throughout my stay couldn't have been more friendly or professional. And that's about it for the good news. The hotel is tired and rundown. The room was tiny and cold and the bed the smallest I've ever slept in. There was no bath and the walk in shower, although large, had no pressure and could best be described as a trickle. Add to that no internet, no safety deposit box and noisy neighbours and you have the complete picture.

Reviews.Title: “Park Lane Mews”
Reviews.Author: styaner
Reviews.Content: great little hotel in Mayfair on the edge of Shepards Market.

Reviews.Title: “Gigantic Bed”
Reviews.Author: xmastravels
Reviews.Content: It's taken me so long to write a review... (June 2008): Got the room for a significant discount through the internet, and was tucked away from Park Lane, but just a minute's walk from Piccadilly (A4). The bed was enormous. Never had such a good night's sleep. Room was small, however, and the bathroom was interesting. Doubt larger businessmen could use the bathroom with the door closed. Staff were very polite, and the communal areas were very well-kept, something you would obviously expect at such a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small and dated but great location”
Reviews.Author: Aido1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights recently. Thought the location was fantastic right in the middle of mayfair and close to the underground and some lively pubs. But the rooms were small, dusty and not the nicest decor i have ever seen. The breakfast was very poor also. For the price we paid for the hotel i wont be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and run down, but clean and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jimindc2007
Reviews.Content: I can't say that this is a contender in the "best of London" race, but the location is great, sitting as it does in Mayfair and around the corner from all the cafes, restaurants and pubs of Shepherd's Market. The rooms are tiny and the furniture long past new, but the place is clean and the management is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel with shabby rooms, a 2 star at most”
Reviews.Author: Marylin100
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as no other options for the last minute booking. Price was GBP 250/ night taxes included, for a "deluxe" room. Stayed there for one week, but felt like ages, I could not wait for this week to end. It is a pitifull hotel which has made me think that its owners do not care at all about the state it is in, as its relatively lower prices compared to other mayfair hotels would always attract tourists given its relatively good location. Front desk staff try to be friendly but that does not mean efficient, or that they'd in any way make up for all the shortcomings of this old and tired hotel; shabby rooms, old looking and in no way well-kept hotel, furniture, walls, carpet in a terrible condition. Small room with no place to open the luggage. No minibar, 2 out of the 3 phones not working. Advertised free WiFi but good luck to get connected from the room - mission impossible. Air conditioning not working, sleeping with windows open means hearing all motorcycles parked in the moto parking located just in front of the hotel. Noisy garbage bins' collection early in the morning. Dont waste your money on any meal here, too expensive and poorest I've ever seen in London, there are many good restaurants in the neighbourhood. Drinks seem to be half the size of those ordered elsewhere for the same price. 2 full time employees at night, they do everything from concierge to bar tender, receptionist etc. TV has only 90% arabic channels. No way this is a 4 star. Wanted to change rooms when I found out that they have a couple of refurbished rooms, all set and confirmed, prepared my luggage in the morning, when coming back at night they explained there was a misunderstanding, so no new room, nice waste of time having to unpack. I bet in the meantime all new guests requested the same ;-) I never received the explanation they promised to give. They couldnt care less, that's the overall attutude. Avoid it if you can, wouldnt spend more than 1 or 2 nights there again unless if I absolutely have to. The only reason why other guests must have given it positive evaluations can only be justified by them having had one of the refurbished rooms, otherwise I cant see how one can comfortably sleep in that room and rate it 4 or 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: ErnShepparton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in here in Park Lane ,London for 8 days in August 2011,quite expensive but thats London.The Room was facing rear of another hotel-Hilton I. Noisy emptying bins etc in morn. Room and Bathroom very small but adequate. No Fridge. Service and breakfast very good,and the location in heart of Park Lane was superb-Pubs and restaurants a 2 minute walk in Shepherd Market, Green Park Tube station about 10 min walk-all major attractions close by and easy to get to. Hotel a bit tired overall but had a little charm.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel close to Park Lane Hilton. Dirty. Old. Tired.”
Reviews.Author: Ballencrieff Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally behind the Park Lane Hilton. So the location is useful and the bus stops that take you anywhere in London are close, as is Green Park Underground Station. This is not a cheap hotel, simply because of the location. It is adequate if you cannot find anything else. It looks old and tired. The carpet is stained. Some of the doors are unpainted and splintered. Room and bathroom were small. HOWEVER, everything you could possibly need is there. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sharon123Halstead Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: A lovely atmosphere, the staff were friendly and very helpful. The suite was small but very comfortable. This is not a modern hotel but had everything we needed for a short break visiting London. We really enjoyed it

Reviews.Title: “Not a-mews-ed!!”
Reviews.Author: Missyeast
Reviews.Content: Very hard to locate situated behind the Hilton, but was impressed from the outside. Comfortable, very clean, super room, but let down by the buffet style breakfast arrangement. Nothing very hot, served on cold plates, ran out of most things and had to wait 15 mins while they made more. We had our tea and coffee served to us at the end of the breakfast. We had a late breakfast, heaven knows how they cope when its really busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the hotel...”
Reviews.Author: TheGlobetrotta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a handy location, just off Park Lane with some nice little shops and pubs nearby and looks good from the outside. However, I found my room to be uncomfortably hot (the air conditioning didn't work properly), my bed quite lumpy, and the room was noisy too. Was also not overly impressed with the service, especially at the front desk. The breakfast is quite nice though and the waitresses pleasant enough. Room service was not bad too and the shower was quite powerful and easy to use. Limited choice of channels on the TV and Wi-Fi connection in the room was quite weak too. Would agree with other reviewers that this hotel could do with some fresh decoration. Not the best London hotel I have ever stayed in !

Reviews.Title: “Proms in the Park”
Reviews.Author: fannyfanackapan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Lane Mews with our daughter and son-in -law because it was only a short walk after Proms in the Park in Hyde Park, and they had stayed there previously. We found it to be a charming, cosy, old style hotel, with courteous and helpful reception staff. Our rooms on the fifth floor (there is a lift) were not huge but everything necessary was there, including tea making facilities; they were nicely furnished and decorated and everything was clean. The beds were fine for average sized guests, but a bit small for us, and as always, we would have liked more pillows (we used the dressing gowns as extras). The hotel is directly behind the Hilton and there was a constant low rumble from there throughout the night, so ask for a room on the back if this would disturb you. Breakfast is extra and we didn't partake, but it looked very good, and the dining room was very pleasant. If you prefer character to a faceless chain hotel, The Park Lane Mews is for you. We would happily use this hotel again. Of course it's not cheap - it's London!

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: Martin C
Reviews.Content: Before I even arrived, I had reservations about this hotel. They failed to answer my email sent weeks in advance, so marked down on customer service. My room on the top floor was air-conditioned - Good - but made enough noise to wake the dead. Fortunately I always pack ear plugs. The room was tiny with a single bed. When I sat on the bed, the springs recoiled with the sort of sounds I had forgotten beds could make. As it got dark I wanted to make a cup of tea. However I ended up with the wrong tea, since there were no light bulbs in the lamps over the desk. Nice hole in the wall under the desk. Bathroom was clean and hot water hot and with sufficient flow to have a bath in a reasonable time. Thermostatic shower of the old Mira type also installed - dates it to 1980's I think. Somebody had left a tray outside which was only collected in the morning. Gave a poor first impression.

Reviews.Title: “Same standard as the Hilton next door.”
Reviews.Author: foodiegirltwo
Reviews.Content: The staff were all very good. Our room was ready when we arrived early and we were given a good welcome. The mattress is hard and poor quality, it made a noise every time one of us moved. The air con was too noisy to leave on while sleeping. It bangs and clunks. We did report this. Our main problem was with the door of the adjacent laundry room, which banged shut as the staff came and went. And as they started work at 5.30 am we were woken each morning at 5.30 and could not get back to sleep at all on the second morning ! But its in a great position and as we booked with laterooms we only paid Â£79 on the Sunday and Â£99 Monday. So we would stay again at this price. It is about the same standard as the Hilton nearby, where we stayed last year at a far greater cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: AndyJ1970
Reviews.Content: Nice Friendly staff, good value, bit rough round the edges though. Great location, would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Musing on the Mews”
Reviews.Author: Dessertarian44
Reviews.Content: I reviewed the Mews in Oct. 2009 and noted that despite its obvious shortcomings, I would return because of its location. I returned for a 5 night stay in May 2011. Its location and room rate are still outstanding. The small hotel is near many restaurants in Shepherds Lane. The choice of restaurants in the lane has increased with the stand out being Sofra, the Meditteranean restaurant where we had an exceptional evening meal of mezzes. The staff at the Mews still lack the finesse and training of better hotels. Their personalities range from that of Basil in Fawlty Towers to remarkably efficient as in the case of the young woman who remembered my name so she could forward a phone call to me while I was in the lobby. The rooms are still small and need major refurbishing. We could not close our windows and the noise during the night from hotel workers changing shifts resulted in some sleepless nights (and we weren't in Seattle!). As women travelers, the location meant we could walk to and from the theater safely despite the late hour. Dine comfortably in good nearby restaurants and walk easily to Fortnum & Masons on Piccadilly, shop at Marks & Spencer's convenience store, have breakfast at Pret a Manger or even walk to Harrrod's or the Victoria and Albert Museum. The rooms are clean and comfortable enough to overlook the shortcomings of the staff which I now consider part of the ambiance of the Mews.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Park Lane hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boobyg1
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night in this hotel. The stains on the carpets, the smell in the room, a portable air conditioner instead of a non working central system, worn out furniture, et., etc. I asked to exchange the room and was told it was not possible until noon the next day. One of the worst 4 star hotels I have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby chic!”
Reviews.Author: bewlaybros
Reviews.Content: One night stay last weekend. Like alot of people have mentioned, this hotel is in dire need of a makeover. Threadbare carpets in the bedrooms, scuffed and chipped walls, stained armchairs in the lobby etc. Bedroom on the small size, with the bed not quite a king size. However, this is our second stay here so overall I would classify it as adequate. The best thing about the place is the location. Fantastic. In the middle of it all but at the same time tucked away in a little quiet corner of Mayfair. Have not tried the restaurant so can't comment on that, however, the bar area is very cosy for an evening nightcap after a night out in the West End. I have given this hotel four stars because I have taken into consideration the price I paid, which was less then Â£130. This is one third of the price I paid last year for staying at the Hilton Park Lane hotel, which sits directly opposite the Park Lane Mews and which is not, in my opinion, much better. Certainly not Â£250 better!!! As long as you bear in mind the above and are looking for a reasonably priced bed for the night in the best area of London I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and in dire need of refurbishment. Paddington comes to Mayfair .....”
Reviews.Author: steviewonder123
Reviews.Content: Totally disappointed. The place needs urgent attention. Room was shabby. The air con non existent. Hot water took 5 minutes to arrive. Everywhere had been impregnated with the smell of curry. Only redeeming feature is the location. Could be - and years ago was - an excellent hotel .... I fear all is lost! Beware, this hotel needs urgent refurbishment and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Location was excellent”
Reviews.Author: AstaSoi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights on the third floor. Windows to the Hyde Park direction. Pros: The location was very good, near Piccadilly, in the corner of Green Park and Hyde park. There were excellent cafes for breakfast down the Shepherd street so you probably don't want to pay extra for breakfast at the hotel. Cons: The sound insulation of the room was not too good and the window would not shut properly.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously sad and very tired - Iike me after I arrived”
Reviews.Author: MissLeahM
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a romantic night in London. What a mistake. Despite being rated 4* this hotel disappointed me from the moment we walked into the lobby. This hotel has had NO money spent on it for the last 15 years. There is paint chipped off everywhere, carpets threadbare and generally tired. Our room, even though being told we had a 'large one' was small and tacky. Later I complained and moved into a bigger room but the bathroom was still aged, heating unit clunky and the view and noise, terrible. Oh yeah, the 'free' internet was so slow it was impossible to use.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a bit of a revamp”
Reviews.Author: HoeGrangeHoney
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before about 5 years ago and enjoyed it then, unfortunatly the decor is looking very tired now , Matress was hard and lumpy and the extractor in the bathroom did not work, we changed rooms after the first night, the matress was better but the extractor in that room didn't work either. rooms at the front sufffer from noise from about 7 am due to bin empying and deliveries fro the hilton over the road, this is no fault of the Mews hotel but worth asking for a room at the rear. This is a lovely little hotel exellently palced for a break in the city, but a little investment soon nreturn it to it's former glory.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Postgradresearcher
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel before 9 in the morning and was immediately allocated my room which was beyond my expectations. The staff were welcoming and friendly. This is a rather old hotel but comfortably furnished and up to the four star standard. The room was sufficently large with a double bed and lots of space for a solo traveller. The hotel is situated between Park Lane and Piccadilly and this gives immediate access to all of the bus and tube routes. Situated a few hundred yards from Shepherds Market this gives access to lots of delightful little restuarants. Breakfast in the hotel is rather expensive and since I was on a room only basis I opted to walk around the corner to one of the excellent little cafes in Shepherd Street where a good English breakfast costs around Â£5. WiFi is free but a bit intermittent in the bedrooms. For leisure or business this hotel can be reommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep ever in a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reikibob
Reviews.Content: Had read all the reviews after I had booked the Hotel and was quite worried as to what we would be getting but needn't have feared. The staff were all very friendly and efficient when booking in. The room maybe slightly on the small side but was more than adequate and what would be expected for a very old Hotel. It had everything that we needed and certainly for the 2 night there we had the best sleep ever of all the Hotels we have stayed in- so comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was first class , great choice, all fresh and more than enough for anyone to eat and again the Staff were friendly and efficient. The receptionist phoned for a taxi when leaving and it was there in 5 minutes- all in all a great place to stay and look forward to going back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but otherwise pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Malcz86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Valentines day weekend. Check-in was quick (no one else waiting) and staff were friendly and helpful. Room was small but comfortable. Yes there's not much of a view but the location is great. The hotel was not luxury but is far from undesirable.

Reviews.Title: “Falling Apart”
Reviews.Author: platermo
Reviews.Content: Despite the location which is right next to Shepherd Market, it sits right behind the service entrance of the huge Hilton next to it. The reception staff tries hard to be polite but in such a non-elegant manner that it is annoying. Check-in took 15 minutes and the receptionist indiscretely would voice out all the information of the guest in front of me, I even knew how much he was paying, what his name was, his adress, and room number, this to me is unacceptable. The hotel did not have any power adapters for my computer and after a kind discussion with the receptionist I was to walk to the nearest convenience store to get it, approx. 10 pm, after some time it was solved but please management, stock up on these items it makes the stay much better, the cost less than 1 pound each. The room was too small, but especially the bathroom and the smell of the room were disguting. The bathtub was rusted and the water smelled like rust as well. The toilet hardly would flush. TV was limited to 6 channels, 3 of which were in arabic. Breakfast was ok, good selection, and quality was ok, even though there is always a feeling of uncleanliness. One guest burnt his toast and the waiters opened the door facing the street in order to get the detectors not to sound, regardless of the 2 degrees celcius that were outside and freezing guests. Ordering a taxi is difficult, they first send you to walk to the hilton where there is a queu, if not they seem to get a commission from a cab company whichi is the only one they call, problem is it takes them 20 minutes to pick you up. Internet was free but worked only in a corner of the room, not when the computer was on the bed. At check out again the receptionist listed loudly everything i had consumed infront of other guests, it embarrassed me, when i asked if they could print out my boarding pass, they said they couldn't and i should walk to a close by fruit shop to have it printed. This is basic in a hotel that caters to business travellers. This place definitely does not deserve 200 euros a night as what we spent, it is a 3 star hotel at the most.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star hotel, tatty and pretty poor'”
Reviews.Author: rehab71
Reviews.Content: The below is copied and pasted from the list of complaints I have just sent to the hotel. The hotel is in a great location and is cheaply priced for it's location, however it's marketed as a 4 star which it is not! â€¢The general appearance of the public areas (lift/hallways etc) are very tatty and out dated, both lifts have carved 'graffiti' on the inside of the doors. â€¢The above theme continued in to our room which desperately needs a refurbishment. â€¢There is a large crack on the counter/dressing table. â€¢There is also a large crack in the sink. â€¢There are 3 tiles missing in the bathroom under the (cracked) sink. â€¢The shower rail is covered in rust and some of the screws that hold it up are starting to come away and are very loose, this is potentially very dangerous. â€¢The extractor fan in the bathroom doesn't work. â€¢All the rooms (I assume all rooms as nearly every review on tripadvisor.com mentions it) have oil filled heaters in them. Why doesn't your central heating work correctly and where was the air conditioning that your website boasts? â€¢The trouser press wasn't attached to the wall properly and was coming away. â€¢It took about 6 or 7 minutes for hot water to come through the shower in the afternoon, what a waste of water! (Again, mentioned on tripadvisor.com) â€¢I had to ask twice to have an iron and ironing board sent up and when it arrived the ironing board only had a thin, cotton ironing board cover and no padding thus rendering it pretty useless. â€¢The tissue box in the bathroom had not been refilled, it only had 3 tissues in it and there were only 1 and a bit toilet rolls. â€¢The hairdryer was beyond useless as it over heated with about 30 seconds of use and we had to wait for it to cool before we could use it again and this took around 5 minutes. â€¢Your website shows a wide selection of 'Molton Brown' toiletries on display in the bathroom, we had the 'Molton Brown' holder, not the nice toiletries to match. I don't think Molton Brown would be happy to know that their product is being cheapened by your hotel! â€¢The net curtain was dirty and had some holes in it, it also had some bodge repairs with pins at the top. â€¢At least one of the towels had a hole in. â€¢The breakfast was pretty poor on all accounts. We came down for breakfast at around 9:30 and judging by the temperature of some of the items I think they had been there since the start of service at 7am. I've had better breakfasts at truck stops and they're half the cost

Reviews.Title: “Needs some TLC!”
Reviews.Author: LLINK
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for the weekend for a pre valantines break. The hotel is in a great location and good value for money. The interior is a little tired, as are the bedrooms. The double room was small and I've slept on floors that have been more comfortable. However, with a little investment, this hotel could be classed as a boutique hotel. The staff were very professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, no hotel in london is any better than this one.”
Reviews.Author: lara024
Reviews.Content: Not much to really say about this, other than everything i experinced was perfect. Lara Cameron-wells

Reviews.Title: “Great Cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: wolsty07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this week with my colleague as we had meetings all over central London. The hotel is Cosy and Friendly and is in the perfecty location to walk into London. the room that we stayed in was small and a bit tired but otherwise comfortable. yes there are piortable heathers in the rooms as other people have mentioned but we just turned ours down and got a great nights sleep. Not 4 star really and do not expect luxury but the seated area downstairs is much more comfortable than staying up in your room anyway. Friendly practical and great location - for the price perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The worst and most rude staff ever”
Reviews.Author: LintC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as I had my work Christmas party at the Dorchester just around the corner. I booked my room through laterooms.com and was so pleased at getting what was listed as a 4 star hotel at such a great price. Unfortunatley I found the room to be shabby and tired with peeling paintwork and no sign of the air con that was advertised, just an old plug in heater. The staff at the front desk were pretty clueless and took an age to find my details even though I had a printed confirmation. The worst was yet to come. The next day my credit card fraud department called to query some transactions including a Â£50 charge from the hotel that I had no knowledge of. I was obviously concerned so called the hotel. A very rude and obnoxious indian man told me it was taken in case I ripped them off and made phone calls etc without paying. When I pointed out that they really should make the customer aware of this extra payment and that he had a really bad attitude, he refused to tell me his name, told me he was the manager, then the director, insulted me and slammed the phone down. I wouldn't expect this kind of treatment from a 1 star hotel, let a lone a 4 star establishment. I complaained to laterooms but a month later I have heard nothing. My advise is don't stay here as they will take your money and treat you with absolute contempt.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: scuddington
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here new years eve and we payed Â£250 for the a room next to the lift that kept us awake also the people queing for the lift having a chat outside the room disturbed us , the room was cold and the small heater provided clicked all night the room was shabby with wallpaper peeling from the walls the carpet was stained and i was too scared to look at the bed. The tv was far too big for the room with only 3 channels and even they had a bad reception and when we arrived there was a great big long brown hair in the sink. I did not take a hair dryer with me as in the literature it said one was provided in the room couldnt find it any where, new years eve posh restaurant booked and my hair in a ponytail (not happy) In the morning about 10am there was a knock at the door from the cleaner wanted access to the room we told her the room was still occupied and she then retured 10 minutes later which made us feel that we had to rush geting ready, trust me I wanted to leave asap but we knew we didnt have to check out until 12 and had intended to find somewhere nice for breakfast but the cleaner made us feel pressured to vacate. My husband implored me not to say anything when we checked out as the reception was busy so I sent them an email listing all my complaints it is now 20th jan and still no reply, this alone speaks volumes.

Reviews.Title: “Could not sleep from water flow in heather, cold, noisy, smelly, shabby, terrible condition”
Reviews.Author: car1980616030
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room for 99GBP. Worst hotel I have ever been. Italian gay guy at reception, first appeared very friendly. Overchaged my card, was difficult to get refund. (never pay for more than one night). Next room fighting couple, boyfriend beeting up his girl, eventually they were turn away. Only managed to sleep 3 hours from the constant water flow in heather under the window which did not actually work. Electic heaters added to the room to warm the rooms a bit, that gave clicking noise every time it turned on. Dirty and worned out futniture everywhere. Night guards were helpful after complaint. Pictures on web has no relation whatsoever to the real condition of the hotel, it is unaccepteble. Unfortunately it is not possible to upload the video I made. For the same money you can go on web and book Best Western at Saftersbury avenue (theather district, much better location) and really desent hotel for 92 GBP + VAT including breakfast (go for double room there, only 2 GBP difference).

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Inspector would have a field day!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 186349Disappointed
Reviews.Content: Totally disappointed. The reception totally belied the sad state of this hotel. We had a sad small room that needed updating, they hadn't even bothered to take out the old huge TV cabinet (which took up a lot of space) just stuck the new slim tv on top. Stuck bits of trim on here and there in a half hearted attempt at modernising the room. Very small room, half the lights didn't work, all the doors and dado rails in the corridors looked like they had had a good kicking, threadbare carpets. We didn't even bother to go down to breakfast. A lot of money paid just for an area name.

Reviews.Title: “not what I would describe as 4 star boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mumsell
Reviews.Content: Have only been in the hotel 2 hours and feel compelled to write this review before I've even slept here. It's really not what I'd call a 4 star or a boutique hotel. OK, the room's an Ok size, but there only seems to be one plug socket which means I can either charge my laptop OR keep warm. Oh yes, the heating is provided by a stand alone electric heater, so without it the room is freezing. And there's no hot water for a bath or shower. I was told to run the taps for 10 minutes to get it hot.... and after 10 minutes of wasting water, it's still cold. A poor selection of toiletries and no biscuits have been the final straw. and the bathroom looks like it could do with a good scrub.

Reviews.Title: “dont book this hotel with late rooms.com”
Reviews.Author: woodpecker65
Reviews.Content: we havent stayed in this hotel ,but ifeel the need to let people know how badly we have been treated. We booked this hotel with late rooms on 21st November and received a confirmation e mail. We then booked our train and restaurant as this is aspecial occasion.Then on the 25th November someone phoned to say there wasnt a room available,they would find us another option!!! The other option they found us was a 3 star apartment called The Curzon plaza but when i phoned them they had a different room rate to what was specified, i then phoned late rooms and they said it is the responsibility of the hotel to find you another room.After loads of phone calls and and hassle we decided to book elsewhere. I just want to warn people that even if you receive a confirming e mail the hotel is probably fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MatthewGreen
Reviews.Content: Writing as a former hotel manager and now auditor who is very familiar with the star ratings given by the AA and Visit Britain Iâ€™d strongly suggest that this hotel is a 2 star, at a push! Having read the reviews here I was naturally anxious about staying at this hotel. Initially I was actually very happy as I had been upgraded to a suite which was certainly very spacious. However, given that this was supposedly the best suite in the hotel then I honestly dread to think what the other rooms are like. So, overall quality issues: -The carpet was stained in places and appeared very â€œweatheredâ€�. I donâ€™t know if it was actually really dirty or just very old. -The grouting between the tiles in the bathroom was heavily stained in places (photo). -There was black mould on the ceiling in the shower area (photo). -The wooden toilet seat had split in several places which is a hygiene issue which doesnâ€™t bare thinking about (photo). -There was chipped paintwork on all the door frames and skirting boards. -The mattress was quite phenomenally uncomfortable and I have bruises to prove it. -The full length mirror in the wardrobe was cracked. -The heating was so noisy that it wasnâ€™t possible to sleep with it on. -There was only just enough pressure in the cold water tap to get a slow trickle of water which stopped completely if you flushed the toilet. There are plenty of other standards set out by the star rating agencies where this hotel fails to meet the requirements of a four star or some of these even apply to 1 star: -Only 1 bedside lamp (Should have 2). -No hotel information given on check in. -No luggage assistance offered. -No â€œin roomâ€� guest directory or information. -No published phone charges. -No hair dryer. -No apparent laundry service. -No heated towel rail. -No invoice/receipt presented on departure. I know that individually each point Iâ€™ve raise may sound petty, but when I see so many poor maintenance and service issues then itâ€™s a different story. I had a glance around reception to ascertain whether or not this hotel is registered with Visit England or the AA and I donâ€™t think it is (hardly surprising as theyâ€™d definitely fail a hotel inspection). This means that the 4 stars they advertise as is â€œself assessedâ€�. Having said all that, the location is just behind the Park Lane Hilton and it is considerably cheaper than the alternatives in the area. But youâ€™d probably get a better nightâ€™s sleep in a cleaner environment at a Premier Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and Comfortable, well situated”
Reviews.Author: caz6050
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant stay. Lobby is very welcoming, Martin at reception was particularly helpful as we hadnt been allocated a twin bed room as requested. He was able to give us King bedroom instead, which was obviously larger and was clean and very comfortable. It was abit noisey from the street at night because the windows are the old sash type and it could do with being double glazed with air conditioning. Didnt eat in the hotel but it looked inviting

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: London1953
Reviews.Content: Room was grubby, dirty carpet. Bathroom tired and in need of a really good clean. No electric points worked except the one the useless TV was plugged into. Room entry cards didn't work on more than one occasion. Overall the hotel was a disgrace especially as it is supposed to be a 4 star hotel- Bring in the Hotel Inspectors!!. Oh! Breakfast was just passable.

Reviews.Title: “No air-con, no service, no future for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pgsnapper
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a very hot spell and found that the air-con didn't work. They sounded surprised and upgraded us to another room - but air-con still didn't work. We nearly melted. Talked to other guestes - same problem throughout hotel. Complained and they admitted it was a problem in most rooms. No duty manager. Had to call them on the Monday and eventually was promised a refund of Â£100 but that took 3-4 weeks of chasing to get it. Shabby chic with the emphasis on 'shabby'. They don't deserve to be in business.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dated, shabby but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lipschick
Reviews.Content: Is this REALLY a 4 star hotel? I've stayed here several times in the last few months, it is near my office, this is the only reason. I have now given up. The rooms are very hot, the air con units very noisy, open a window and you may as well sleep outside, talk about noisy! The location is superb, Shepherd Market is nice, it is a short stroll to both Piccadilly, Green Park, Hyde Park, Park Lane and Mayfair. You can get is for Â£100 ish on Laterooms or similar, never ever ever pay anymore than this. Ever. I am recommending it, just for location and the cost factor

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever”
Reviews.Author: Edward7London
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel ever. The photos look great but have obviously spent nothing on the place since Hilton. The hotel absolutely stunk of curry, even at 11.00 pm. the ground floor ladies toilets were disgusting, not cleaned and the pan was full ! Rooms are tired and everywhere is dirty round the edges. Going out for breakfast to Shepherd's Market ! Don't bother to stay here - Premier Inn and Travelodge a much better option if you are after something reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A mouldy dump. And a manager who couldn't care less.”
Reviews.Author: TinaHarrisment
Reviews.Content: our room reeked of mould - it had, if you can believe this, a dehumidifier in the room to try & take out the wetness in the room. very unhealthy. AND - though the manager credited most of the night's stay & says, and i quote "we won't put anyone else in that room until the wet carpet issue is resolved" - they still won't credit all of it. "you stayed in the room". we were supposed to check out at 10 pm then and find somewhere else?? very dangerous to the health to inhale mouldy spores.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars - Are you serious?”
Reviews.Author: klynn48
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a quaint lobby, but that is it. The room had no A/c and we were told it had been a few days since it worked.... and..."in London we are not required to have air conditioning" was the comment from the gentleman at the front desk. There was a fan in our room, but it was so filthy, we could not turn it on. The window wouldn't stay open, so we had a rolled up towel in it to keep it up. The rug was also quite dirty and worn. It was so bad, we slept in our clothes for the one night we were there. Faded and scuffed wood in the halls. To top it all off, wi-fi was advertised, but it was only available in the lobby if it worked at all. Very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very co-operative Staff & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: amitsharda
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just perfectly located for Business meetings, rooms were not very big but comfortable and had value for money spent in the hotel. Staff was very co-operative and knew the defination of the term HOSPITALITY towards their guests.

Reviews.Title: “old English charm on a small scale..”
Reviews.Author: Mucki1406
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic; right in the heart of May Fair, Sheperds market; Hyde Park across the street, as in fact is Green Park and Buck Palace and Knightsbridge, all in walking distance. The hotel has a lot of charm, but is quite worn on the edges. I recommend it for a short stay, specifically fi you can secure a booking via one of the many online booking networks, in which case you get value for money. The regular rack rate is overpriced for what is offered,; the rooms are small, as are the hallways, so it can be noisy as other guests leave or come back from/to their rooms. Note: the single rooms are "cute" i.e. minute, and you need to be sporty to manouvre around the shower room. For breakfast I recommend one of the "cafs" in Sheperds market ..... Considering the surrounding neighbourhood and regular price structure, the service , or lack of, is a little suprising, perhaps guests get treated acccording to booked rate ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Somersault0
Reviews.Content: Well, I will start with the positive, The hotel is in a fantastic location, but that is it. All down hill from there. Check in is a farce, with their own non standard policies, that make checking in a long and hard experience for the business traveller that has pre booked and paid on line. Staff are confused and dont understand basic business practices. Hotel may have looked good once, but is now run down, poorly equipped and dirty, especially the bath rooms, and ceilings, and window sills with their cigatette burns on. I stayed in 203, and will never stay there again. Hot water is available only after you have let the taps run for ten minutes, in deed a member of the reception staff had to come and show me, as after 2 minutes I assumed it just did not work. A massive waste of a precious and expensive resource. Food was edible, but I wouldn't if I was you, there is a good variety of restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: RobertDavis10023
Reviews.Content: The friendly front desk staff do not make up for the pitiful condition of this hapless property.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: mmk26
Reviews.Content: As a woman traveling solo in England, I had the good fortune to stay several days in the Park Lane Mews Hotel. This charming small location had a number of advantages: 24-hour concierge, charming sitting room/breakfast area, and access to Shepard Street right around the corner with at least seven interesting well--priced restaurants--think of Polish-Mexican cuisine, as one example. The people working at the desk all maintained a steady cheerfulness and willingness to help with the smallest details from arranging a tour to making the least expensive international phone calls. Located near Hyde Park in the elegant area of Mayfair, this place provided a respite from the overwhelming crowds in busier parts of the city. I would certainly return to this spot.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Accor property in the heart of Mayfair, but do not expect much if anything at all”
Reviews.Author: Jetlaggard59
Reviews.Content: Due to last minute business itinerary changes we had to select a hotel in the heart of London on a pre determined budget....knowing that London is a very expensive city the expectations were not high....we chose this hotel based on location and price ....check in was a bit of a circus with the staff mocking each other as they fumbled through the process of check in....dissapointed customers were voicing their opinions as to the accuracy of the room description and the parade of such complaints during the check in process was a bit embarrassing after a while....the room itself was of course small, the bed was very poor with the most budget mattress available with no pad for relief, add lumpy sodden pillows and you knew the night would not be the best...the bathroom was depressing with the shower head showing horrid brown stains, the ancient wood door showing the years of abuse and cleaning, the lights were weak and few....all in all, the only positive about this hotel was its location....so if you are ready to bear the brunt of the condition and maintanence of this property in exchange for a low price and good location than you may consider it a fair trade....just do not go into the situation with hopes for a comfy, clean, proper British property....

Reviews.Title: “If you booke through Lastminute, dont expect an invoice for expenses - off anyone!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chippyqueen
Reviews.Content: Hotels service is a bit shabby - have been chasing an invoice for weeks and they dont seem to respond to emails. I also complained about the lifts not stopping on the 5th floor - myself and another guest were stood for 10 minutes waiting. I rung the front desk who were less than proactive. Shame - as the hotel is in a great spot, can walk down Park Lane to Oxford Street and there are some amazing little restaurants and bars in a pedestrianised area. The Curzon cinema is near by as is Green Park Tube. Hotel rooms are clean enough but the interior is a little shabby and worn which is a shame considering what they charge - I've stayed here once or twice before. Not bad if all you want is somewhere to sleep and are not fussed about the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid. Seriously.”
Reviews.Author: LilaRoseLondon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here a few weekends ago while we spent some time in central London. The hotel was nicely located. The outside was pretty enough and the lounge downstairs had a charming old library vibe going on. The staff were polite and helpful at check in, the problems started when we got up to our room. The room was tiny, for a start, with mismatched furniture and a really ugly plaid headboard. The bathroom was tiny. All of this I could deal with, but when we sat down on the bed, it groaned like a dying animal. It was horrible and lumpy and so uncomfortable. The air conditioning was broken and the window wouldn't stay open so on a hot and muggy evening we had to keep getting in and out of a cold shower (which was more of a trickle than anything). Room service was also extortionately expensive. Luckily we spent very little time in the hotel as we were so busy. But I would NEVER go back and don't recommend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Jacky_9
Reviews.Content: The position of this hotel is lovely but any other good points stops there. On arrival one of the male receptionists was very offhand and after seeing the room I returned to reception and asked if they had any other rooms, to which the reply was 'Why, whats wrong with the one you have'.He then told me all the rooms were the same and that the only suite they had was taken until the middle of August. The room was tiny, the carpet stained, air conditioning not working and it was like an oven with a tiny fan which did nothing at all. The bathroom was so small you could hardly turn around. Unfortunately, my husband had gone off to a business meeting while I checked in, so I had no choice but to stay. We had originally tried to book the HIlton but unfortunately it was full. We have stayed in the Hilton many times before and this hotel should take a look around there and learn some lessons in cleanliness, maintenance and manners.

Reviews.Title: “This is my home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: PsiChi
Reviews.Content: After trying many hotels in London since 1970, I I have stayed at the Mews for weeks at a time 2x a year at least for the last 5 years. The staff is excellent and attentive; they are like family to me. They all address me by name and are extremely helpful. I especiallly love the fireplace, delicious breakfast, location, quaintness and service. My bed and high quality sheets/duvet are extremely comfortable, and the towels are large and absorbent. The bathroom is spotless. It is a refurbished building with all the charm a traditional hotel should have and hard to find anywhere in London for what is offered. . The air conditioning has been upgraded, there is excellent heating in winter. The staff tries its best to accommodate guests. It amazes me to read such picky, bizarre comments - perhaps those people would be better off paying the price to stay at the Ritz. One can only wonder, where they actually live and what is important. It is unfortunate that others spend more time scruitinizing under glass and less time seeing the UK. Yes, I have recommended this hotel to friends from the USA and they were very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Roger28
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location, little else can be said that is positive about this hotel. Staff rude and patronising. No air conditioning it was broken Broken TV Smashed tiles in a dirty bathroom Very tired decor, stained carpet, torn wall paper. How any management can tolerate or promote a hotel like this, beggars belief.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that is really trying!”
Reviews.Author: frodo66
Reviews.Content: I went here with trepidation as the reviews I had read were awful The fact that, probably one of the hottest days of the year, the air conditioning wasn't working didn't auger too well. But hey, it wasn't the fault of the recepton staff who gave my granddaughter a free teddybear with the name of the hotel on its sweatshirt, put a fan in the room and gave us free iced water. So the rooms aren't the most modern but so what.. The breakfast was very good and the staff, without exception, were very pleasant. There was a lounge, a bar and room service. My granddaughter was a little disappointed there were no films in the room but, for one night, that certainly didn't hurt her. It was far better than the reviews I had read and , yes, I would definitely go there again. I might check if the airconditioning is working but then how many times a year does one need it in England!

Reviews.Title: “great location- not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mellythehoor
Reviews.Content: location brilliant for a gig in Hyde Park. Stayed ont he hottest night so far this year with no aircon. Staff got us a fan which was good of them. Dare not open window because of the noise coming form the hotel across the way. Overlooks the back of the London Hilton kitchen where they empty binns full of what soundedl ike glass at 7am!!. It was torturously hot all night. Rooms tired but if you want a bigger bed opt for the twin room where the room and beds put together is bigger than the double. Decor tired. Might be OK if room did not face the bins andif the stay was in the winter. Location good though

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely dreadful - not even close to being a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca212
Reviews.Content: This hotel was sold by Hilton Group 5 years ago when it was in need of total refurbishment. The new owners have done nothing to it. The hotel is in a sad and tired state. Reception a bad mix of old and worn out furniture. Beds collapsed in the middle, Velvet headboards stained, curtains faded, carpets stained, furniture chipped and marked, bathrooms disgusting with mould. The lift wasn't working and we had to climb to the 5th floor. There is an Indian restaurant in hotel and smell of curry in rooms and corridors. Does not deserve to have a 4 star rating, lucky if it scraped a 2 star. Location/address is the only reason the star is high. Checked out because we felt filthy just looking at the room.

Reviews.Title: “NOT fancy”
Reviews.Author: fancycats3
Reviews.Content: park lane mews? park lane EWWWW. i would have rather stayed almost anywhere else, including a park bench. staff is incompetent and rude; they seem to think they are running a quality operation, which is hilarious. you really have to hand it to them for managing to stay in business all these years despite doing everything in their power to ensure a horrible customer experience. rooms are small, shabby and (almost hilariously) depressing and the bed is torture. walls are paper thin (encourages neighborly feeling) and the room temperature brilliantly fluctuates between the extremities. if you plan to sleep, hit the bottle. this hotel is a joke. i had to laugh to keep from crying.

Reviews.Title: “I won't be going back”
Reviews.Author: Dee-ward
Reviews.Content: I booked this for one night as we were going to a festival in London. I had emailed the hotel beforehand to ask if we could check in early, but got no response, which I didn't expect anyway. I had printed off my reservation number after reading a review here that they tend to lose reservations. And lo and behold, they misplaced mine. I had the piece of paper and everything. But after a few minutes, they said that they would "honour our booking". We felt as though we were being a burden on them. I am not one for complaining, but the attitude of both the manager and the receptionist was really bad form. We had travelled from Dublin and had wandered in the rain for 5 hours because we needed to kill time before we checked in. There were no apologies or anything, they just said that they would give us a double room, even though they had previously informed us that they were booked up for the night. The room and the hotel was actually really clean and nice and in a gorgeous area, it was just the rudeness of the manager that annoyed me and for that reason I will not be returning. It is most definitely not a 3* standard, this I agree with.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Palmeat
Reviews.Content: Let's cut to the chase - Â£110 a night for a central London hotel very well located for Hyde Park, Knightsbridge and Piccadilly isn't expensive - but don't expect luxury. This is a 3 star hotel at best which is in need of refurbishment. Staff were pleasant and attentive on our visit - just one night to rest our head after a meal out with friends (who were staying at The Ritz where a round of drinks for 4 cost Â£75!). Room was OK, although aircon wasn't working (but I didn't raise with reception). Not sparkling, but not grubby. Coffee making facilities were fine, bed was comfortable and large screen TV was new. Only problem was we had a room at the front which overlooks the rear of the Hilton and their night staff were very noisy throughout the night. Hardly Park Mews' fault? Nearby parking was discounted at Â£18 for 24 hours and no more than 100yds distant. If you fancy a decent location at a very competitive price - but are realistic with your expectations, you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: SFM001
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no where near a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. I have hardly ever experienced staff that were more unfriendly, in fact this hotel takes first prize in the 'service' department. Arriving at about 1800 on a Friday the staff at the reception were busy eating their sandwitch and speaking with their mouth full. Charming. The bed was reasonable size but in a tiny room. To say the room was small is an understatement. No wifi internet as they claim, only in the lobby, sorry, entrance is the more correct word as the lobby was inexistant. All in all a disappointing hotel but in a reasonably good location (albeit basically in the kitchen of the Hilton!) Do not get deceived by the 4 star rating, 2 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SherpaB
Reviews.Content: Good, quiet location and big comfortable bed, those are the positives. My room was nothing like the pictures on the hotel's website - instead it was small, tatty and 3-star quality. The breakfast was Travelodge quality, with watered down juice. It's simply not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some of these reviews sound....”
Reviews.Author: BucksTraveller45
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel before reading these reviews and were really worried so I rang and spoke to Don? on the front desk . He said that as we were last minute bookers we couldnt cancel but he would ensure we had a good room. He was as good as his word and we turned up to be greeted by a very jolly front reception team and you know what..........the room was great ,nice , clean and well furnished. The bathroom was on the small side but overall no where as bad as some of these reviews indicate. Moral of the story ring ahead and get some commitment to a good experience from a manager, it worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: fairywings2507
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely no way on earth this is a 4 1/2 star hotel. We booked this hotel on Wotif from Cairo, and because of very slow internet were unable to do the research we normally do before booking a hotel. This hotel is very old and dated. The rooms so small you couldn't even swing a cat. I wasn't expecting a huge room for a European city, but this is ridiculous. We couldn't even get our luggage in. When we complained to the manager, we were told this is the quality you received for a 4 star hotel. This was advertised as a 4 1/2 star hotel on Wotif, and I know for a fact this is not the quality to expect from a 4 or 4 1/2 star hotel. I have stayed at better 3 star hotels! The manager did upgrade us to a 'deluxe' room that was only slightly larger than the standard room. The beds had springs in them that were dead, and you rolled to the edge of the bed. The sink plug got stuck and it took them 2 days to fix, and there were exposed electrical wires on the floor in the bathroom, which were still not fixed by the time we left. The only redeeming factor was that the girls on reception were very nice. Take my advice and stay in a back packers, I think you'd get better value for money and a better nights sleep!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, ideal location for Ritz, staff very friendly & helpful”
Reviews.Author: debs74tw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is minutes from Green & Hyde Parks. We booked one night as we were going to the Ritz for Afternoon Tea. The location was very quiet, but within minutes of pubs, restaurants and shops. The double room we had was clean and tidy, although it wasn't huge, and the bathroom was looking a bit tired. The reception, bar area & corridors were all very well presented. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, we thought Â£15 / person was too much, so found a very nice cafe just down the road. Our only complaint is that the room heating system 'gurgled' water all the time, even though it wasn't actually on. We would consider booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “4-Star my ****”
Reviews.Author: Chryspy
Reviews.Content: Planned a special 2 day break to celebrate a 50th birthday - obviously read the wrong review website! Arrived at the door and my immediate expectations were far beyond the reality which awaited. Staff on reception very pleasant, location turned out to be better than expected - then we went to the room. Dated, drab, the decor needed returning to the wall and the quiet room requested was immediately adjoining the lift shaft. The twin room requested was a double, the heater broken, Satellite TV not worth having, mould around the bath seals. Second morning the simple act of taking a shower proved too much - no hot water! This followed a night of a Spanish couple deciding to keep the entire floor awake for two hours whilst they indulged in a 'domestic' which everyone could hear, though not neccesarily understand, and which the nioght staff could not manage to calm. Breakfast; side plates but no breakfast plates. A request for a suitable piece of crockery was met with a nod at a side plate and the response, "Won't that do?" Subsequent official complaint resulted in being offered a 'free upgrade' the next time I chose to sepnd several hundred more pounds when booking into the Park Lane Mews Hotel. If I ever do revisit the ccapital I might well choose to swallow the ignomony and book into a Premier Inn - at least I know what to expect and save a substantial amount of funds. As I said, "4 Star my ****"

Reviews.Title: “A cold shower”
Reviews.Author: Fusilijerry
Reviews.Content: Very worn and generally tired. The lobby smelt of body odour on arrival. I was given room 509, the room light did not work, the air-conditioning unit was broken and at 6.15 am there was no hot water to shower with but the body odour was still there in reception. Not a 4 star hotel - very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “what a rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: sammieeeeee
Reviews.Content: Dont bother with this hotel. It is not 4-star. It has some of the rudest staff on reception, i have ever come across and it's sub-standard in just about every way you can think of. From shabby decor, cheap loo paper, no mini-bar in the bedroom, coat hangers falling to bits in your hand, lights not working, i could go on and on! Thank goodness the show we saw that night, was fabulous and the restaurant we went to beforehand, as otherwise the trip we had been looking forward to ,would have been a huge let-down. I do not recommend this hotel in any shape or form, dont go there !

Reviews.Title: “Tatty & dated”
Reviews.Author: Flooshant
Reviews.Content: My husband had booked this hotel without reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. There was no going back now, so we were not looking forward to the visit to the hotel in anyway, however having this in mind, I think that the hotel was very dated in it's decor, no hairdryer in the room as stated, no mini bar, in fact nothing really, just 2 cheap shower gels and 1 Molton Brown body lotion, just enough for 1 person. We were charged Â£145.00 not including breakfast. There was a very noisy air conditioning system, that sounded like there was heavy rain all night long, bizzar. I would not reccomend this hotel at all, really dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here it's horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Frankie98
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels and this stands out as the worst. No heating, electric shock off a broken plug on a heater, rude staff. This is a complete cowboy operation where they over work the staff so there miserable and don't invest in the hotel. The managment/owners are making the world a worse place for many people.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest room I ever seen in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: hasselmc
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, Breakfast area very limited, you may have to wait to get a seat in the morning between 08-09:00hrs. Rooms very small. Prices very reasonable compared to other London hotels. Nice restaurants in the area. Suggest to have a dring at the Trader Vik's.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting. Do not even think to stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yiannis_9
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel that ever stayed in my life. It is 1 star and definetely far off from 4 star. Terrible condition of furniture, cold rooms with the heating system out of order, rude receptionist, satelite TV with only arabic channels, smelly, dirty carpets. Wallpaper peeling off all four walls, bathroom really tatty and shower useless. Location is good but stay in another hotel in this area. Definetely you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “This is definitely and absolutely not a 4 star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Albamorena
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location but this does not make up the 4 stars claimed. Rooms are outdated, with a noisy fun heating system, wallpaper in many places is coming off so is the carpet.
